comments.body: Yes, but this also means skeleton horses would have to spawn with armor. Unless they could also spawn normally now please!
I agree with the variants for the horses. If they make them burn that will anger alot of people. So maybe the zombie ones only. Besides bones being burnt doesnt completely make sense..
Just the saddles could make them stop burning. I agree that they "need" to burn under sunlight because they are undead.
Not only this, Ocean Monuments should be Deeper down and less numerous in the oceans. Its super easy to find them nowadays and should be a challenge going in and getting out.
I agree with this, but I think that trident-wielding drowned should still drop their weapons. Given that elder guardians don't respawn, it wouldn't make sense to have a non-reusable weapon.

Restricting the spawning of Trident Droweds to Ocean Monuments and also increasing their spawn rate can also make it easier for people to access Tridents which are very hard to obtain now, especially on Java.
I think the gold could be raw gold blocks. And that some kind of Monument Well  (3, one for each elder guardian) could be found somewhere in the structure, like the trial vaults.
There's already barely any threatening mob in this game, and you remove one [Trident Drowneds] that actually threatens a Player and gives Projectile Protection a slither of use .
Make the trident craft-able with prismarine shards and quartz
There are alot of possibilities here.
It could be capped  on maybe camel dash speed as a refference.

The base damage + the speed based damage. No multiplying, no acceeding past a damage cap that needs to be added.

The spear is far less risk vs. reward than the mace is. I understand maces having a need for gaining more damage, but after so many blocks it should cap... The spear is so easy to use it appears that there is just no way anyone will survive fighting a player on a horse.
capping both mace and spear attack could be reasonable, however keeping weapon work differently from other stuff seems necessary to justify it existing

Respawn anchor and End-Cristal pvp are bad basically because the 1-hit kill: there's no time to react. Maces could be an exception, as they are best to surprise attacks. However, players still could change weapons and armor while fighting, though this means the need of some skills to do it correctly, also means that the combat system is made for speed of actions rather than strategy and planning, in other words, you can't "craft" your victory by reacting wisely, but just acting fast.
I don't think a removal of the mechanic is necessary but it absolutely needs a damage cap, especially when it automatically hits multiple people on contact without the need to time it

I hope Mojang will introduce another mob vote, Barnacle, which will be added to the game. They will add it soon. Minecraft Live is really disappointing because of Mojang, as there is a lack of crowd integration that is perfectly implemented in the game!
Mojang is introducing the mob vote, called Barnacle, which will be added in the snapshot and in the beta/preview version!

Bedrock addition has an Achievement named "Mokstraumen" for exactly that. I know the achievements in Bedrock and the Advancements in Java aren't supposed to have full parity with one another, but, yknow, at least there's already a name for it.

You could also do something similar to how I suggested it to be in this post while not being the same it is certainly similar https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/40703906356237-Coloured-Nautiluses-Shells but overall still a good Idea!
I agree, but it should be more powerful (half a block is a short distance, especially on the battlefield).
Preferable they would have a new saddle type please
I would make these potions have a reaaaally short duration. No more than 10 seconds.

I think its critical that this potion allows for lunging over a longer time scale: the whole point of this proposal is to allow lunging to be used for creative movement options like parkour and minigames (without having to stop every few seconds). I believe a 3-8 minute potion is critical. A few ideas to achieve this without breaking the hunger system:

1) The potion does not apply the benefits of saturation (like amplified regeneration)

2a) The potion could strictly affect Lunge's exhaustion, and not affect other forms of hunger/exhaustion (sprinting, jumping, swimming, etc.)

2b) The potion could minimize (rather than completely negating) all forms of exhaustion

A potion with a "really short duration" misses the point. We already have an unstackable option to negate exhaustion for a few seconds (suspicious stew of saturation). We're missing an option to allow Lunge for more than a few seconds.
I loveeee this idea. It would be great to not have to think about eating to sprint and be able to always lunge. Although this needs to be better balanced, and shouldn‚Äôt affect regen from food

I think Skeleton Horses are made to not burn in sunlight because they are so extremely rare, and you don't want them to spawn only for them to burn up before anyone's even seen them. That being said, I think a better solution would just be for undead mounts to not burn in sunlight when being ridden. Helmets already protect undead humanoids, riders would basically be the helmets of the mounts.
Alternatively, skeleton trap horses could just be immune to burning before they are activated

The thing is that riptide takes a little to launch you and only works in water/rain and ender pearls can't be stacked, have a cooldown and take a moment to land. But yeah how much it consumes is absurd.
I think it should take the same durability that riptide does on tridents, and maybe lower the hunger cost to 4 for lunge I, 3 for lunge II, and 2 for lunge III.
Higher tiers could consume more hunger, as it deals more damage.

The thing is that the spear doesn't need skill because of being able to just hold and being easier to aim than other weapons + you'll use it while moving fast so it's harder to hit you. Spears should be weaker with elytras but stronger in everything else.

The jab is way too weak and the charge, while running or in a horse, is useless. It needs a buff for that but a nerf when you have really high speed. Maybe adding 1 or 2 damage to the jab and making it grow damage faster at first but slower the faster you go would fix this, making using it while on a horse way better but not having a big difference when used with an elytra? Idk

I totally agree with this. To me, not being able to kill a cow in 2 hits with a diamond spear feels ridicule. In my opinion, they should increase the damage by 1 all across the board, but keep the charge attack damage the same. I'm not sure if the charge attack is scaled based on the basic jab attack damage, but i believe it is not the case, so it won't buff the charge at all.

Also, i feel like the attack speed (unless they change the other weapons) is unnecessary. I would keep it the same despite the material and fix it to 0.8 or 0.9 . This will balance the slightly higher damage as well as the range.
The mace should be better than the spear. The spear is a day one weapon, but you need to go to at least one trial chambers to get the mace.
I think the ridable mobs should stay in a 16 block radius where you last dismounted them

With the latest change to the lunge enchantment in this last update, it would make even more sense to swap this action. Now if a player uses a spear with lunge, they are throwing themselves into a fight right up onto the opponent with no more viable options other than to try and run away with it or to swap to a more close range weapon.

As it is right now, why would you want to use a spear with lunge knowing you'll need multiple weapons to make it work? It will cause people to either need to pick up more weapons on them, adding to inventory clutter; or they'll just not use the spear in the first place.

If lunge replaced the charge attack, you could use the normal jab attack, finish them off with the lunge, or do some variety of both. It would create a situation where you would want two different kinds of spears: ones intended to be used for jousting and ones effectively used on foot.

Rather than "replace" the charge attack outright, the lunge attack could simply replace the charge attack while on foot, allowing for it on horseback or with an elytra, where it would be and is the most effective use for it. As it is, when on foot the charge attack acts as a sort of static defense, which is fine and can be useful. The Lunge attack on foot would be a more aggressive playstyle, where the spear is more dynamic. This way we would get the best of both worlds, and the only difference in playstyle to choose would be a more defensive one or offensive one, rather than cutting off a major mechanic entirely.

I've been able to lunge and couch in one action a few times. This is an immensely satisfying combo. Problem is it that it seems impossible to pull of consistently. 

If the "lunge" enchant turned the unmounted couch into a lunge that also couches the weapon, it could replicate this satisfying combo and pull-off the distance judging aspect the unmounted spear seems to want to have. Quick jabs to attack at range, and then lunge for a killing blow.

Of course, a trivial lunge-into-couch combo shouldn't deal 33 hearts of damage. And at that point I would like to recommend buffing the jab very mildly. :P

I'm glad that Mojang is going the route of introducing new weapons to play around with in PvP, and I hope this will also be a wake-up call to start working on the Combat rework once again. However, I think as they are now, Spears have a lot of potential and simply feel like they can't reach them with the way they're being treated right now. Without good game feel, the Spears will never feel fun to use, which I think is by far the most important part of a weapon's design. Just swinging around the thing should feel satisfying. As such, I hope this idea reaches the developers and is received well.

I should also mention a quirk I forgot to mention in this rework: When charged up fully, the Spear should deal critical damage. It'd help to incentivize timing your attack well and making well-timed attacks feel like big meaty stabs, as they should.

Great suggestion!
We as players needs proper balance and there should be a skill gap.
Currently you have 10 seconds to perform attack with same damage dealt which is ridiculous.

Mace is also powerful weapon but you need good timing to use it and it also needs to be "charged".

Dear Mojang

Plz, add mending to the spear
Neat dungeon concept!

You can find dark oak buttons in woodland mansions and they lead underground to reveal a ravenger with an illusioner on it, and maybe killing the ravenger will reveal a secret passage that has a chest in it, or a barrel, that has a new item in it, the ravenger horn, it can summon a ravenger that is passive and is temporary, but can do the same thing as a normal one, it is MOUNTS OF MAYHEM, by the way!
The bow is from a chest btw
Idea, what if the illusioner is a raid boss that spawns on the final round of the raid and has 250 hp
